intro: Commelina poligama, commonly known as the common spiderwort, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers and slender, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its flowering period usually occurs during the warmer months, and it produces small, three-lobed seed capsules. Commelina poligama is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
